page.title: 01Huip Area
page.content: The Holm of Huip is an island. It is a grazing land for many sheep, there are approximately seventy ewes. During the lambing season lambs are often attacked by Black Back Gulls, these are carnivourous sea birds who attack and often kill defenceless young lambs. The Holm is a place where you often sea seals, and birds nest there as it is so peaceful. Farmers go across twice a year to shear and dip the sheep. The air field is quite a big field with a small bit of concrete for the plane to land on. A small hut is also provided to shelter in. The field that the plane lands in has a small mound that is an ancient buriel ground. This mound is called the Green Hill. Little Linga is a seal sanctuary owned by the Fern Trust, this island also has sheep grazing on it.
